      • onCreateViewHolder

        public abstract K onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup viewGroup,
                   int i)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called when RecyclerView needs a new RecyclerView.ViewHolder of the given type to represent an item.

        This new ViewHolder should be constructed with a new View that can represent the items of the given type. You can either create a new View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file.

        The new ViewHolder will be used to display items of the adapter using #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int). Since it will be re-used to display different items in the data set, it is a good idea to cache references to sub views of the View to avoid unnecessary View.findViewById(int) calls.

        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<K extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        viewGroup - The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
        i - The view type of the new View.
        Returns:
        A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int), #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int)

      • onBindViewHolder

        public abstract void onBindViewHolder(K k,
                    int i)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called by RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. This method should update the contents of the RecyclerView.ViewHolder.itemView to reflect the item at the given position.

        Note that unlike ListView, RecyclerView will not call this method again if the position of the item changes in the data set unless the item itself is invalidated or the new position cannot be determined. For this reason, you should only use the position parameter while acquiring the related data item inside this method and should not keep a copy of it. If you need the position of an item later on (e.g. in a click listener), use RecyclerView.ViewHolder.getAdapterPosition() which will have the updated adapter position.

        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<K extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        k - The ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        i - The position of the item within the adapter's data set.

      • getItemCount

        public int getItemCount()
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Returns the total number of items in the data set hold by the adapter.
